nodes.bodyText: Define and throw a dedicated exception instead of using a generic one.
Return an empty collection instead of null.
Method createJob has 6 arguments (exceeds 4 allowed). Consider refactoring.

nodes.bodyText: Method createJob has 6 arguments (exceeds 4 allowed). Consider refactoring.
Not fixing this issue because alternatives like a builder pattern add more complexity. Personally, I feel the 4 parameter limit is too tight.
This reduces the level of noise in the aggregator logs.
LGTM, as we're only changing this for our local config.
Style change. null is redundant.
since and transactionTime are new.
requestPatientFromServer now does a search for so we can pass lastUpdated
This change is kind of subtle. When lastUpdated is specified an empty bundle does not mean that the beneId doesn't exist, rather it may mean that a resource didn't match the lastUpdated parameter.
Nitpick here, but would it make sense to simply pass the optional value, rather than a null?
This error message isn't very clear to me, what's it signaling?
Probably a stylistic change, but given this ternary spreads across multiple lines, maybe it makes sense to split this into an if/else statement.
+1. Would improve readability.
Do we want VSCode settings in the repo?
It's not clear to me why this changed. We don't need to check the resource type anymore?

Good question. Every job, including those ** without** a since parameter, is now time-bound by the transaction time. This is done for correctness. So every request to the BFD is now a search with a lastUpdated set. This change has the happy side-effect of making the getPatientFromServer API have the same signature as the Coverage and EOB methods. So, the special case if statements are no longer needed.
This text is actually from a version of the FHIR spec. I'm replacing it with the current version which is more precise. Also, the real change I needed to do was move from String to a InstantDt
Method createEmptyBatch has 6 arguments (exceeds 4 allowed). Consider refactoring.

In a recent commit we switched from passing in the environment variables directly and are using an envfile instead. We should follow the same pattern for the API service as we do the aggregator service.
Roger.
This was pulled out into it's own PR now, so I suspect this change will go away once rebased with master.

nodes.bodyText: Nice usage of @Named, but I'm wondering if this is going to get confusing. Thoughts if it would make sense to make an interface extension IGenericBBClient and IGenericAttributionClient so the code is cleaner and we don't accidentally import the incorrect client?
I see the advantage of your suggestion. However, that is a big change affecting many files. I suggest that I do this change in a follow-on PR.
Sounds good to me.
Looks great!
Good call on reusing/renaming this!
